titlestmt.titleproper: Kenneth Lee notebook and fractional gold coin photographs, circa 1932-1969, 1979
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Kenneth Lee notebook and fractional gold coin photographs
did.abstract: Notebook of detailed descriptions used to produce Lee's book California Gold Dollars, Half Dollars, Quarter Dollars and photographs of his collection of fractional gold coins.

daodesc.p: Part of a page from one of the notebooks

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kenneth W. Lee (1907-1980) was the author of California Gold Dollars, Half Dollars, Quarter Dollars (1970 & 1979), an updating of California Gold, Quarters-Halves-Dollars: a Descriptive List of Privately Issued, Interesting and Historical Coins of Small Denominations (1932), which was written by his father, Edward (Ed) Melvin Lee (1871-1943). Kenneth was born in Glendale, California, and was a graduate of the University of Southern California. He worked briefly in advertising before joining his father in the coin and medal business in 1930. He became a member of the American Numismatic Association in 1932, the American Numismatic Society in 1944, and was one of the organizers of the California State Numismatic Association in 1947.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The photographs were donated by Anthony Terranova of New York City in 1996. The notebook was acquired from the Harry W. Bass Jr Numismatic Library sale (George Frederick Kolbe, part 4, June 10, 2000) through the generosity of John W. Adams and George F. Kolbe.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: There is no record of the custodial history of the photographs between the time they were produced and used by Kenneth W. Lee for his book California Gold and the time they were donated to the ANS by Anthony Terranova in 1996. The notebook was purchased by Harry W. Bass Jr. from the Kenneth W. Lee library sale (Kolbe, June 12-13, 1981, lot 612) and kept as part of his library until it was purchased for the ANS in 2000.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kenneth Lee notebook and fractional gold coin photographs, circa 1932-1969, 1979, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Three-ring bound notebook containing pages from Edward (Ed) Melvin Lee’s book California Gold, Quarters-Halves-Dollars (1932) that have been heavily annotated by Edward and then by his son, Kenneth. This would result in Kenneth’s updating of his father’s work with his own book, California Gold Dollars, Half Dollars, Quarter Dollars (1970-1979). The notebook may have been continually updated from approximately 1932 to 1969. In it are detailed descriptions, diagnostic notes, pieces reported but not seen, pedigrees of known specimens, auction appearances, and other notes. Items found loose in the notebook include a letter from dealer B. Max Mehl offering Edward five rare California gold dollars from the Waldo Newcomer collection, along with rubbings of the coins (1932), and a certificate of copyright from the Library of Congress for Edward’s book (1932). Also present are photographic negatives and contact proof sheets of Kenneth’s collection of octagonal and round fractional gold coins, including Kroll hoard pieces, in twenty-five cent, fifty cent, and one dollar denominations (1979).
